timeline.bodyText: Is the flownode that the boundary event is attached to already terminated when the boundary event completed? I would expect some logic here to check whether the boundary event is interrupting or not.
timeline.author: korthout

replies.bodyText: This logic is in the activity itself. When the activating event is written for the boundary event then it was already triggered and the activity was terminated - if it is an interrupting boundary event. So, there is no much to do here.
replies.author: saig0
